trans-unit.source: Hosts one or more <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentReference"></xref> elements that define a sequence of fixed documents.
FixedDocumentSequence hosts an ordered sequence of one or more fixed documents that are organized as a single unit.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentReference> is the only allowable child element in a FixedDocumentSequence.
Each <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentReference> refers to a single <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument>.
Document reference elements must be in sequential order, matching the order in which the fixed documents are processed.

A collection of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentReference> elements contained in a FixedDocumentSequence can be obtained using the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence.References%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence"></xref> class.
Gets the paginator for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> that provides page-oriented services such as getting a particular page and repaginating in response to changes.

If you need a paginator with automatic repagination in responses to changes, such as adding content to the document, derive a class from <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DynamicDocumentPaginator> which itself inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator>.
An object of a class derived from <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref> that provides pagination services
Gets an enumerator for accessing the document sequence's <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentReference"></xref> child elements.
An enumerator for accessing the document sequence's <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentReference"></xref> child elements.
Creates an automation peer for the sequence.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer"></xref> that exposes the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence"></xref> to Microsoft UI Automation.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that is associated with this document sequence.
A <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> contains printing information such as whether to print on both sides of each sheet.
Setting this PrintTicket property does not validate or modify the specified <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.

If needed, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>-specific <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is valid for a given printer.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> for this sequence.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence.PrintTicket*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets a collection of the document sequence's <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentReference"></xref> child elements.
A collection of the document sequence's <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentReference"></xref> child elements.
Gets the service object of the specified type.
An object that specifies the type of service object to get.
A service object of type serviceType.
-or- if there is no service object of type serviceType.
Adds a child object.
The child object to add.
Adds the text content of a node to the object.
The text to add to the object.
Gets or sets the base URI of the current application context.
The base URI of the application context.
